unitTitle: Unit 4: The World Around Us - Past Continuous & Used To

grammarTerms.definition: An action that was happening at a specific time
grammarTerms.example: I was walking home when it started to rain.

grammarTerms.definition: Past habits or situations that are no longer true
grammarTerms.example: I used to play football every weekend.

difficultWords.example: We saw a bag of rubbish on the street.

difficultWords.definition: A person who studies ancient civilizations
difficultWords.example: Ancient places are found by archaeologists.

difficultWords.definition: Made dirty or harmful with waste
difficultWords.example: Did the town use to be polluted?
We didn't use to recycle rubbish.

difficultWords.definition: A group that performs or studies plays
difficultWords.example: Mum didn't use to go to a drama club.
Healthy food isn't made with additives.

phrasalVerbs.definition: Take care of someone or something
phrasalVerbs.example: The old owner didn't use to look after the garden.
Simon's family used to throw a lot of rubbish away.
The lights went out while we were watching TV.

keyPhrases.definition: An action in progress at a past time
keyPhrases.example: I was cycling home when I saw a new house.

keyPhrases.definition: A short action that interrupted a longer action
keyPhrases.example: We were walking when we saw a bag of rubbish.

keyPhrases.vietnamese: trong khi (hành động dài đang diễn ra)
keyPhrases.example: While I was walking to school, I met my friend.

keyPhrases.definition: Past habit that no longer happens
keyPhrases.example: We used to spend a lot of money.

keyPhrases.definition: Something that was not true in the past
keyPhrases.example: I didn't use to like vegetables.

usefulExpressions.example: The energy bills used to be expensive.
People didn't use to drop a lot of rubbish in the park.
